page.title: 08AGRICULTURE: MANOR FARM
page.content: During the year we have made a lot of visits to Manor Farm. This belongs to Mr Cumber who has a son at the school. The farm has about 1,000 acres with 21 fields. This is divided into about 300 acres for wheat, 180 acres for maize,190 acres for grass and 330 acres for barley. He has 160 Friesian cows. These give milk and the young bulls are sold as beef. He has a big cubicle house which takes 80 cows at a time for milking. We let the calves suck our fingers. Each cow gives on average 6,000 litres each year. He gets 14p for each litre.
